topic.title: Is it possible to combine a real website with zeronet?
topic.body: I'd like to know if it's possible to combine a real website with a zeronet website, in order to have several "interfaces", one hosted on my personal server to make sure the website is efficiently hosted, and a zeronet website to make sure that if the main website falls, the other websites can still exist?

1554327160_12x9LSYMyy5B7Dgy2LviuD5B2TkJR.body: I was talking indeed about an interactive website, like a forum basically.

> [leftside](#comment_710_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): I was talking indeed about an interactive website, like a forum basically.

Thanks for the answer. So I was talking indeed about an interactive website, like a forum basically. Do you have any reference for making this kind of interfaces? I'm also affraid that sharing database could corrupt it no?

Also, I'm thinking about something: is 0net.io slow to display pages because this gateway serves tons of websites, or is it slow for more fundamental reasons? For example, could I imagine to do my own gateway that would serve only my own website, and hope to have speed comparable with the normal website ?
